intro: Podonephelium pachycaule, commonly known as the thick-stemmed star bush, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody, cylindrical stem and clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are arranged in star-like patterns, giving it its common name. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its growth habit is typically shrub-like. Podonephelium pachycaule is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or dry forest areas.
